title: Cape Lookout National Seashore: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons      Cape Lookout National Seashore is open 24 hours and 365 days a year.  Operating hours for visitor centers and other services will vary throughout the year. Hours Harkers Island Visitor Center:  Summer Hours (April - October): open daily from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Winter Hours (November - March): open Monday - Saturday from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 pm  closed Sundays, New Year's, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Days Beaufort Visitor Information CenterSummer Hours (April - October): open daily from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.Winter Hours (November-March): open Tuesday - Saturday from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  closed Sunday, Monday, New Year's, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Days. Light Station Visitor Center & Keepers' Quarters Museum are open from April to November and from 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. The Cabin Offices at Great Island and Long Point are open from mid-March to the end of November from 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM Portsmouth Village Visitor Center is open from April to October (hours vary).  Park administrative offices are open Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. (closed all government holidays)  Services available seasonally Ferry service: Passenger ferry service to Shackleford Banks and to the Cape Lookout Lighthouse is available all year (weather dependent).  Vehicle ferry service is available from mid-March to the first weekend in December.   Beach Shuttle: Truck transportation from the Cape Lookout Light Station to the point of Cape Lookout is available from mid-May to mid-September. Cabin rentals are available from mid-March to the end of November.
